title: Artist Palette

verbs: Apply paint to; coat with paint
To fill a portion of a drawing with paint (color or a pattern).
Practise the art of painting pictures.
To practise the art of painting pictures.
nouns: A color (the color of the sky at night and a blackbird's feathers) that is created by the absorption of all light and reflection of none; dark and colorless.
The color of the face.
A type of firecracker that is really more dark brown in colour.
The visual perceptual property corresponding in humans to the categories called red, green, blue and others, along with any variation, quality, or property thereof
A visual attribute of things that results from the light they emit or transmit or reflect
A property of quarks, with three values called red, green, and blue, which they can exchange by passing gluons.
Spectral composition of visible light.
The spectral composition of visible light
An attribute of things that results from the light they reflect, transmit, or emit in so far as this light causes a visual sensation that depends on its wavelengths.
The color of wine is one of the most easily recognizable characteristics of wines.
Color or color is the visual perceptual property corresponding in humans to the categories called red, blue, yellow, green and others.
Paint is any liquid, liquefiable, or mastic composition that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, converts to a solid film.
A substance used as a coating to protect or decorate a surface (especially a mixture of pigment suspended in a liquid); dries to form a hard coating
Colored composition applied over a surface that dries as a solid film
A substance that is applied as a liquid or paste, and dries into a solid coating that protects or adds color/colour to an object or surface to which it has been applied.

A mixture of pigment and a vehicle, such as oil or water, that together form a liquid or paste that can be applied to a surface to provide an adherent coating that imparts colour, protects the surface and/or gives the surface different features.
Aesthetic value.
The creation of beautiful or significant things
The creation of works of beauty or other special significance.
Process of creating things of no intrinsic value but significant extrinsic value through emotional or aesthetic appeal
Art is the process or product of deliberately arranging elements in a way that appeals to the senses or emotions.

Art is a diverse range of human activities and the products of those activities; this article focuses primarily on the visual arts, which includes the creation of images or objects in fields including painting, sculpture, printmaking, photography, and other visual media.

description: A palette used by an artist when painting, to store and mix paint colors.
